oai_dc:dc.dc:title: WAVE RUN-UP ON COMPOSITE SLOPES
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Saville, Jr., Thorndike
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: wave runup
laboratory experiments
coastal structure design
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A method is presented for determining wave run-up on composite slopes from laboratory- derived curves for single slopes. The method is one of successive approximations and involves replacement of the actual composite slope with a hypothetical single slope obtained from the breaking depth and an estimated run-up value. Comparison of predicted values is made with actual laboratory data.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 6 (1957): Proceedings of 6th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Gainesville, Florida, 1957.; 41
